docs.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES CALIFORNIA CUISINE, New American Cooking, Western Regional Food - whatever you call their style of cooking, restaurants in this city have come of age. Judging from a recent 10-day dining spree among both established and newer eating spots, it appears that the up-and-coming generation of Los Angeles chefs has reached a self-assured and refined level with an identity uniquely its own. Many of these newcomers bring with them formal training in French cooking that allows them to distill the best of what has come before. Twenty years ago California cooking was associated with health food and vegetarianism. When French nouvelle cuisine came along in the 1970's, chefs here began experimenting with the abundance of fresh produce in the state to devise some engaging - and occasionally bizarre - creations. The current generation has studied the possibilities and come up with its own interpretation.

headline.main: NEW RESTAURANTS IN LOS ANGELES: A STELLAR CROP
